column4: ok... can someone help with building apache2 on ubuntu? there is no make file or anything
would you pastebin an ls of the source directory?
which pastebin do you guys use
but i need it to be built the way ubuntu's is
they provide source mostly so you can build the package natively, i think
natively as in, not just some generic i386 package, but optimized for your system
but seriously, you should just build from apache.org's sources... apache doesn't need to integrate that much with other stuff
watch the language, you'll get kicked in a moment
no that didn't come down with the source.. i have apache2_2.0.55.orig.tar.gz and apache2_2.0.55-4ubuntu2.1.diff.gz
